item.title: Outside 3 Lower Terrace, 12th July
item.description:
A small but deepening pothole in a wider area that is starting to break up. It is on a steep hill and hidden by shadows so would be easy for a cyclist to miss.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Lower Terrace, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees impacting safety, 12th July
item.description:
I am writing to request that the overhanging tree branches in our area be cut back as a matter of safety and maintenance. This is posing a risk to road pedestrians. In addition to this, the low-hanging branches are encroaching on light and nearby properties, creating a nuisance. There is also a risk of safety as not clear to see the other pedestrian or cyclist coming. This has been ongoing for at least 1 year. I would appreciate it if this issue could be addressed as soon as possible
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haseltine Road, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic Issue / Signage, 12th July
item.description:
This road was recently redesigned in Gloucester Terrace leading to Ranelagh Bridge and there is meant to be a restriction of vehicle weight on the bridge but because of the new bollards vehicles of a certain length are getting stuck taking the left turn which is meant to direct them off the bridge. In the last month I’ve seen around a dozen large vehicles being unable to turn left - and then having to reverse, and go onto the weight restricted bridge (right). A double decker TfL bus got stuck for 45 mins. Can you please provide restriction signage on associated roads leading to Gloucester Terrace and Porchester Terrace North as it’s both a safety concern and at night causes extensive noise disruption.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 214, Gloucester Terrace, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging tree branches, 12th July
item.description:
I am writing to request that the overhanging tree branches in our area be cut back as a matter of safety and maintenance. Large vehicles regularly strike the branches, posing a risk to road users and pedestrians. In addition to this, the low-hanging branches are encroaching on light and nearby properties, creating a nuisance. During the autumn months, the volume of falling leaves also causes significant mess and contributes to blocked drains. I would appreciate it if this issue could be addressed as soon as possible
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42-104, Bell Green Lane, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose slabs, 12th July
item.description:
This problem has been raised before and still not resolved the so-called contractors were supposed to fix a problem not 40 meters away and bodge it why did they not bodge this at the same time waste of time and our money
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cray Avenue, Poverest, London

item.title: Cator Park Play ground self-closing gate not self closing., 12th July
item.description:

item.title: Lose slabs, 12th July
item.description:
This has already been reported twice you now stated as fixed if you think that simply tipping sand on the path and sweeping it in is fixed i suggest that you take a look at the so called repair and get it done properly the slabs are still sticking up and move underfoot why do you except the contractors word that they have repaired the faults without checking their work god help us it’s our rates your spending without even checking
